stories.text:
My company builds B2B software that has integrations with other systems. These usually require an API key or similar.

When connecting to these systems, we need the API key as plain text.

What is the best practice for storing integrations API keys?

Storing it as plain text in our DB, might be risky in case our DB is compromised.

Thanks
stories.title: Ask HN: Best practice for storing API keys securely in a B2B SaaS

stories.text:
I've been reading Scott Galloway's recent post on a possible future downturn:

https://www.profgalloway.com/down-round/

His post, focused on startups in a bear market, got me thinking - how can we, as developers, best prepare for a downturn and possible recession? Are there specific sectors that are a safer bet in a recession, or should we simply focus (even) more on employability (gaining experience in multiple tech stacks, etc)? Are there lessons that people learnt from the the Dot-com Bubble and the 2007–2008 Financial Crisis that we need to remind ourselves of? Thanks in advance.
stories.title: Ask HN: How to prepare for a major downturn as a developer?
